contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Yarra Glen|the arterial road in Canberra|Yarra Glen, Canberra}} {{Infobox Australian place | type = suburb | name = Yarra Glen | city = | state = vic | image = Grand Hotel Yarra Glen.jpg | caption = Grand Hotel, Yarra Glen | lga = Shire of Yarra Ranges | postcode = 3775 | pop = 2598 | pop_footnotes = (2006)<ref name="abs">{{Census 2006 AUS | id = SSC27083 | name = Yarra Glen (State Suburb) | accessdate = 2007-10-01 | quick = on}}</ref> | est = | elevation= 152 | alternative_location_map = Australia Victoria metropolitan Melbourne | pushpin_label_position = left | latd =37 |latm =38|lats =56 | longd =145|longm =22|longs =19 | stategov = [[Electoral district of Seymour|Seymour]] | fedgov = [[Division of McEwen|McEwen]] | dist1 = 40 | location1= [[Melbourne]] | dist2 = 15 | location2= [[Lilydale, Victoria|Lilydale]] | dist3 = 16 | location3= [[Healesville, Victoria|Healesville]] | near-nw = [[Kinglake, Victoria|Kinglake]] | near-n = [[Steels Creek, Victoria|Steels Creek]] | near-ne = [[Dixons Creek, Victoria|Dixons Creek]] | near-w = [[Christmas Hills, Victoria|Christmas Hills]] | near-e = [[Tarrawarra, Victoria|Tarrawarra]] | near-sw = [[Bend of Islands, Victoria|Bend of Islands]] | near-s = [[Yering, Victoria|Yering]] | near-se = [[Coldstream, Victoria|Coldstream]] }} [[Image:Yarra Glen VIC War Memorial.JPG|thumb|right|War memorial and hall]] '''Yarra Glen''' is a town in [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]], 40 km north-east from Melbourne's [[Melbourne city centre|central business district]]. Its [[Local government areas of Victoria|local government area]] is the [[Shire of Yarra Ranges]]. At the [[Census in Australia#2006|2006 Census]], Yarra Glen had a population of 2598. ==History== The Ryrie brothers (William, James and Donald) were the first Europeans to settle in the area, when they established the {{convert|43,000|acre|km2}} Yering run in 1837 after droving their cattle to the area from NSW. The brothers planted the first grape vines in the Yarra Valley in 1838 and produced their first wine in 1845.<ref>{{Citation | title = Yarra Glen | publisher = Heritage Australia | url = http://www.heritageaustralia.com.au/search.php?state=VICÂ®ion=67&view=341 | accessdate = 2011-01-10 }}</ref> [[Joseph Furphy]], often regarded as the father of the Australian novel, was born on the station in 1843.<ref>{{Citation | url = http://freepages.genealogy.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~bcollins/general/famous/tom.htm | accessdate = 2011-01-10 }}</ref> The Post Office opened on 11 January 1861 as Yarra Flats and was renamed Yarra Glen in 1889 when the [[Healesville railway line|railway]] arrived.<ref name = "a">{{Citation| last = Premier Postal History | title = Post Office List | url = https://www.premierpostal.com/cgi-bin/wsProd.sh/Viewpocdwrapper.p?SortBy=VIC&country= | accessdate = 2008-04-11 }}</ref> The now National Trust-listed Yarra Glen Grand Hotel was established in 1888.<ref name="YarraGlen">{{Citation | title = Yarra Glen | publisher = Tourism Victoria | url = http://www.visitvictoria.com/Regions/Yarra-Valley-and-Dandenong-Ranges/Destinations/Yarra-Glen.aspx | accessdate = 2011-07-25 }}</ref> Its four story Italianate tower was added subsequent to the construction of the original hotel building.<ref name="YarraGlen" /> The [[Black Friday (1939)|Black Friday]] fires of 1939 badly damaged the area around Yarra Glen, as did [[2009 Victoria bushfires|the fires of 2009]]. ==Sport== The town has an [[Australian Rules]] football team competing in the [[Yarra Valley Mountain District Football League]]. Yarra Glen has a [[Thoroughbred racing in Australia|horse racing club]], Yarra Valley Racing, which schedules around nine race meetings a year including the Yarra Glen Cup meeting in March.<ref name = "RaceClub">{{Citation | title = Yarra Valley Racing |url=http://www.yarravalleyracing.com.au/ | accessdate = 2010-09-02 }}</ref> Yarra Valley [[Harness racing|Harness Racing]] Club conducts regular meetings at its racetrack in the town. <ref name = "harness">{{Citation | last = Australian Harness Racing | title =Yarra Valley | url = http://www.harness.org.au/yarravalley/yarravalley.cfm?fromstate=vic | accessdate = 2009-05-11 }}</ref> ==See also== * [[Yarra Glen railway station]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * [http://www.visitvictoria.com/Regions/Yarra-Valley-and-Dandenong-Ranges/Destinations/Yarra-Glen.aspx Yarra Glen] - Tourism Victoria website *[http://www.yarraglen.com.au/ Yarra Glen Tourism Website] *[http://www.yarraglen.com/ Yarra Glen Website] {{Shire of Yarra Ranges suburbs}} [[Category:Towns in Victoria (Australia)]] [[Category:Yarra Valley]] {{VictoriaAU-geo-stub}}
